result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 11, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:20 AM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Evan R Trewyn.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:06 AM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court with attorney Abigail Broze for Peter M Wolff.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is residing at Teen Challenge, 5301 N 91st St, Milwaukee, WI 53225.  Mail should go to the Wauwatosa address.
Attorney Wolff was just appointed to this matter.  
Attorney Broze requests a furthe proceedings date to review the file and obtain an offer.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
09:59 AM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Court passes matter to allow defendant to complete the petition for appointment of counsel.
Case recalled at 10:15.
Court reviews and grants the petition for appointment of counsel.  Defendant to pay $100.00 per month commencing 7/8/22 and the 8th of each month thereafter.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on June 14, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B/Elmbrook Church listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

02:17 PM Defendant Evan R Trewyn in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
